sentences.text: This directive led us to launch an enhanced sustainability strategy and vision in 2016 that focuses on positive transformational changes toward a regenerative, healthy and abundant world.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continuing our focus on accelerating growth and increasing shareholder value, we are proud of the progress weve made in terms of acquisitions.

sentences.text: Over the course of the year, we added David Michael and Fragrance Resources  the latter of which closed in January of 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: David Michael is well-known for its vanilla expertise, strength in the Dairy and Beverage categories, and relationships with dynamic, faster-growing middle-market customers.

sentences.text: Fragrance Resources increases our participation in Specialty Fragrances, a faster growing sub-category within Fine Fragrances, and strengthens our market share position with a regional customer base.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are pleased with our progress in 2016, which in large part was due to our industry-leading innovation and ability to provide our customers with superior products.

sentences.text: We increased our annual dividend double-digits  for the sixth consecutive year  and continued to repurchase our shares to achieve a 71% total payout ratio of adjusted net income*, above our 50-60% stated goal.

sentences.text: In 2016, we saw the pace and speed, at which change occurs, accelerate, with rapid movement in consumption, exchange rates, raw materials and politics.

sentences.text: We leveraged our industry-leading innovation to win in strategic markets, and capitalized on our recent acquisitions, helping us win where we compete.

sentences.text: As we progress into 2017, our journey in leading the world in sensorial experiences continues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By leveraging our strengths  innovation, consumer insights, talent and diversification  we will continue to strive for improved growth and increases in profitability to deliver long-term, sustainable value.

sentences.text: Compensation Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our pay-for-performance compensation program is reflected in the strong compensation governance that we have adopted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Do           A significant portion of the compensation for our NEOs in the form of at-risk variable compensation           Variable compensation based on multiple performance metrics to encourage balanced incentives           Appropriate mix of fixed and variable compensation to reward company, business unit and individual performance           Majority of variable compensation awarded as equity-based awards           Executive clawback policies to recoup cash and equity compensation upon certain triggering events           Executives required to meet share retention guidelines           Independent compensation consultant             Annual risk assessment of compensation programs   What We Dont Do           No tax gross-ups for NEOs for severance payments           No single-trigger vesting of cash or equity-based awards upon change in control           No short-sales, hedging or pledging of our stock by our employees, officers or directors           No fixed-duration employment agreements with executive officers           No stock option/SAR repricing or exchange of underwater options or SARs for cash without shareholder approval

sentences.text: Shareholder Nominations and Proxy Access
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our By-Laws, if a shareholder wishes to submit a director candidate for consideration by the Nominating and Governance Committee, or wishes a director nomination to be included in the Companys proxy statement for an annual meeting pursuant to our proxy access by-law, the shareholder must deliver or mail notice of the request to the Companys Corporate Secretary, in writing, so that it is received not less than 90 days nor more than 120 days prior to the anniversary date of the prior years annual meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if the annual meeting is not within 30 days of the anniversary date of the prior years annual meeting, such notice must be received by the Corporate Secretary no later than 10 days following the mailing of notice of the annual meeting or public disclosure of the annual meeting date, whichever occurs first.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The notice must be accompanied by the information concerning the director candidate and nominating shareholder described in Article I, Section 3 and Section 4 of our By-Laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee may also request any additional background or other information from any director candidate or recommending shareholder as it may deem appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our proxy access by-law permits an eligible shareholder (or group of up to 20 eligible shareholders) who owns shares representing at least 3% of our outstanding shares, and has held the shares for at least 3 years, to nominate and include in our proxy materials for an annual meeting director candidates constituting up to 20% of our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued Service
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee also annually reviews each current Board members suitability for continued service as a member of our Board and recommends to the Board whether such member should be re-nominated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, each director is required to promptly tender his or her resignation to the Chair of the Nominating and Governance Committee if, during his or her tenure as a director, such director:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: has a material change in employment,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: has a significant change in personal circumstances which may adversely affect his or her reputation, or the reputation of the Company, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: intends to join the board of another for-profit company,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: so that the Nominating and Governance Committee can review the change and make a recommendation to the full Board regarding the directors continued service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such resignation becomes effective only upon acceptance by the Board.

sentences.text: Board Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As stated in our Corporate Governance Guidelines, the Board does not have a policy that requires a separation of the Chairman of the Board (Chairman) and CEO positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that it is important to have the flexibility to make this determination from time to time based on the particular facts and circumstances then affecting our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, we combine the positions of Chairman and CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the CEO, as the Companys chief executive, is in the best position to fulfill the Chairmans responsibilities, including those related to identifying emerging issues facing our Company, and communicating essential information to the Board about our performance and strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also believe that the combined role of Chairman and CEO provides us with a distinct leader and allows us to present a single, uniform voice to our customers, business partners, shareholders and employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If at any point in time the Board feels that its current leadership structure may be better served by separating the roles of Chairman and CEO, it may then determine to separate these positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to mitigate potential disadvantages of a combined Chairman and CEO, the Board has created the position of Lead Director to facilitate and strengthen the Boards independent oversight of our performance, strategy and succession planning and to promote effective governance standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent directors of the Board elect a Lead Director from among the independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our current Lead Director is Mr. Morrison.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board recognizes that one of its most important duties is to ensure excellence and continuity in our senior leadership by overseeing the development of executive talent and planning for the effective succession of our Chairman and CEO and other senior members of executive management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of this process, our CEO and members of our Executive Committee are required to prepare a detailed development and succession plan for themselves and for their direct reports on an annual basis.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Role in Overseeing Risk
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board is actively involved in the oversight of risks that could affect our Company and is responsible for overseeing and reviewing with management the Companys enterprise-wide risks and the policies and practices established to manage such risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is the responsibility of the CEO and other senior management to manage the Companys day-to-day business risks and its risk management process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe this division of responsibility is the most effective approach for addressing risk management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management maintains an enterprise risk management (ERM) program which is designed to identify and assess our global risks and to develop steps to mitigate and manage risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board receives regular reports on the ERM process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The full Board and the Audit Committee focus on operational risk, financial risk, regulatory risk, litigation risk, cybersecurity and information security risk, tax risk, credit risk, and liquidity risk, as well as our general risk management strategy, and how these risks are being managed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is primarily responsible for assisting the Board in its responsibility to oversee and review with management our enterprise- wide risks and the policies and practices established to manage such risks, in particular as they relate to financial risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is primarily responsible for overseeing the management of risks associated with compensation policies and practice, our compensation plans (including equity compensation plans and programs), severance, change in control and other employment-related matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Related Person Transactions Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with SEC rules, our Board has adopted a written policy for the review and the approval of related person transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This policy is available through the Investor-Corporate Governance link on our website, www.iff.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the policy, a related person is specifically defined as an executive officer, a director, a director nominee, a beneficial owner of more than 5% of any class of voting securities, an immediate family member of any of the foregoing, or a controlled entity, which is defined as an entity owned or controlled by any of the foregoing or in which any such person serves as an officer or partner, or together with all of the foregoing persons, owns 5% or more equity interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy defines a related person transaction as a transaction or series of transactions involving a related person and the Company, excluding employment arrangements involving an executive officer or other senior officer or employee of the Company and director compensation arrangements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy requires that any such transaction be approved or ratified by the Nominating and Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If accounting issues are involved in the transaction, the Nominating and Governance Committee will consult with the Audit Committee if deemed appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the policy, a related person transaction will be approved or ratified only if the Nominating and Governance Committee determines that it is being entered into in good faith and on fair and reasonable terms which are in the best interest of our Company and our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining whether to approve or ratify a transaction, the Nominating and Governance Committee considers the following factors, to the extent relevant:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the related persons relationship to the Company and interest in the transaction;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the material facts of the transaction;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the benefits to the Company;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the availability of alternate sources of comparable products or services and the terms of such alternative; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: an assessment as to whether the transaction is on terms comparable to the terms available to an unrelated third party or to employees generally.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On August 5, 2008, the SEC approved a settlement with Ernst & Young LLP and two of its partners, including Mr. Ferraro, relating to auditor independence issues arising out of business relationships between Ernst & Young LLP and an individual who was also a member of the board of directors of three of its audit clients.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The matter arose out of actions taken by Mr. Ferraro in 2002 in his role as Vice Chairman of Ernst & Young LLP.

sentences.text: Ernst & Young LLP and Mr. Ferraro resolved that matter by way of a negotiated settlement in which the respondents neither admitted nor denied the underlying allegations and accepted an administrative cease and desist order.

sentences.text: The negotiated resolution did not involve any suspension, fines or other sanctions against Mr. Ferraro.

sentences.text: Mr. Ferraro thereafter remained a partner in good standing at Ernst & Young LLP through January 2015.

sentences.text: Share Retention Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage our executives and directors to own our common stock so that they share the same long-term investment risk as our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Share Retention Policy provides executives and directors flexibility in personal financial planning, yet requires them to maintain ongoing and substantial investment in our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our Share Retention Policy, each executive and director must retain shares of Company common stock at a targeted ownership evel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There is no deadline by which an executive or director must meet his or her targeted ownership level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The targeted ownership evel for directors is five times the cash portion of the annual retainer (not including any retainer for service as a committee chairperson or lead director).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The targeted ownership levels for executives are:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the lesser of shares equal in value to five times base salary or 120,000 shares for our CEO,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the lesser of shares equal in value to three times base salary or 35,000 shares for our CFO and Group Presidents, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the lesser of shares equal in value to two times base salary or 20,000 shares for our General Counsel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an executive or director does not meet the targeted ownership level, the executive or director may not sell or transfer any shares held in an equity, deferred compensation or retirement plan account managed by us, and the executive or director must retain such shares in such accounts until the targeted ownership level is met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For executives, until the retention requirement is met, the executive must also retain a portion (50%, in the case of our named executive officers) of any shares of common stock acquired from the exercise of a stock settled appreciation right (SSAR) or the vesting of restricted stock or a restricted stock unit (RSU) (after payment of any exercise price and taxes).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of March 8, 2017, all of our named executive officers and directors were in compliance with their individual retention requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional detail regarding ownership of our common stock by our executives and directors is included in this proxy statement under the heading Securities Ownership of Management, Directors and Certain Other Persons.

sentences.text: Equity Grant Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has adopted an equity grant policy with respect to the issuance of equity awards under our equity plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the equity grant policy, the Compensation Committee approves all equity awards to our executives except awards to our CEO and to our non-employee directors, which are approved by our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grant date for annual awards to all employees and for annual awards to our non-employee directors is the date of the Companys annual meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grant date for awards under our Long-Term Incentive Plan (LTIP) is the date that the Compensation Committee (or Board in the case of our CEO) approves the applicable LTIP metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the annual grants, equity awards may be granted off-cycle at other times during the year to new hires, employees receiving promotions, director appointments and in other special circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grant price of equity awards (other than LTIP awards) is the closing price of our common stock on the NYSE on the date of the grant or, if the grant date is not a business day, the closing price on the NYSE on the following business day.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grant price for LTIP awards is the 20-day trailing average price of our common stock on the NYSE as of the first trading day of the applicable LTIP performance cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policy Regarding Derivatives, Short Sales, Hedging and Pledges
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our insider trading policy, directors and all employees, including our executive officers and named executive officers, are prohibited from entering into transactions designed to hedge against economic risks associated with an investment in our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These individuals may not trade in derivatives in our securities (such as put and call options), effect short sales of our common stock, or enter into monetization transactions or similar arrangements (such as prepaid variable forwards, equity swaps, collars or exchange funds) relating to our securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These individuals are also prohibited from holding shares of our common stock in margin accounts or pledging shares of our common stock as collateral for a loan.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee directors are eligible to participate in our Deferred Compensation Plan (DCP).

sentences.text: A non- employee director may defer all or a portion of his or her cash compensation as well as any RSUs granted to him or her, subject to tax law requirements.

sentences.text: Additional Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We reimburse our non-employee directors for travel and lodging expenses incurred in connection with their attendance at Board and Committee meetings, our shareholder meetings and other Company-related activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our current directors are eligible to participate in our Matching Gift Program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this program, we match, on a dollar for dollar basis, contributions made by directors to qualifying charitable organizations up to a maximum of $10,000 per person per year.

sentences.text: In November 2016, our Board approved changes to our non-employee director compensation program for the service year beginning with the 2017 Annual Meeting.

sentences.text: Beginning in 2017, the annual retainer paid to our non-employee directors will be increased to $235,000, of which $112,500 will be paid in cash and $122,500 will be paid in RSUs.

sentences.text: In addition, the annual retainer for each of the Chair of the Audit Committee and Chair of the Nominating and Governance Committee will be increased to $17,500 and $12,500, respectively.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee of our Board is directly responsible for the appointment, compensation, retention and oversight of our independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To execute this responsibility, the Audit Committee engages in a comprehensive annua evaluation of the independent registered public accounting firms qualifications, performance and independence to determine whether the independent registered public accounting firm should be rotated, and considers the advisability and potential impact of selecting a different independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has selected PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP (PwC) as our independent registered public accounting firm for 2017, and our Board has directed that our management submit that selection for ratification by our shareholders at the 2017 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PwC has been retained as our external auditor continuously since 1957.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with the selection of PwC, the Audit Committee annually reviews and negotiates the terms of the engagement letter entered into with PwC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with SEC rules and PwC policies, audit partners are subject to rotation requirements to limit the number of consecutive years an individual partner may provide audit service to our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For lead and quality review audit partners, the maximum number of consecutive years of service in that capacity is five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The process for selection of our lead audit partner pursuant to this rotation policy involves a meeting between the Chair of the Audit Committee and the candidate for the role, as well as discussion by the full Audit Committee and management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee and the Board believe that the continued retention of PwC as our independent registered public accounting firm is in the best interest of the Company and our shareholders, and we are asking our shareholders to ratify the selection of PwC as our independent registered public accounting firm for 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although ratification is not required by our By-Laws or otherwise, we are submitting the selection of PwC to our shareholders for ratification because we value our shareholders views on our Companys independent registered public accounting firm and as a matter of good corporate governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe EP is a key factor in identifying the sources and drivers of value across our businesses and that EP growth is closely linked to the creation of long-term shareholder value.

sentences.text: EP measures operating profitability after considering (1) all our revenues and operating costs, (2) income taxes and (3) a charge for the capital employed in the business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Capital employed primarily consists of working capital, property, plant and equipment, and intangible assets.

sentences.text: The capital charge is determined by applying the estimated weighted average cost of capital (WACC) to the adjusted average invested capital employed (including changes and/or loss provisions associated with non-operating events such as restructurings and tax or litigation settlements) during the relevant period.

sentences.text: The Committee believes that three-year Relative TSR, as compared to other public companies in which shareholders may choose to nvest, is a good indicator of our overall long-term performance, and directly ties our executives compensation opportunity to our share price appreciation and dividend payments relative to a major large-cap index.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Relative TSR is calculated by measuring the change in the market price of stock plus dividends paid (assuming the dividends are reinvested) for our Company and the S&P 500 companies over the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The market price for purposes of calculating the Relative TSR of our Company and the S&P 500 on each cycle-end date is determined based on the average closing price per share of each companys common stock over the period of 20 consecutive trading days preceding that date, as reported by S&P Capital IQ.

sentences.text: PRSUs vest approximately three years from the date of grant.

sentences.text: PRSUs are the most rapid way for participants to accumulate and build share ownership based on the participants direct investment in Company stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 120%   SSARs     SSARs are a contractual right to receive the value, in shares of Company stock, of the appreciation in stock price from the SSAR grant date to the date the SSAR is exercised by the participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants receive a number of SSARs equivalent to 4.5 times (i.e. the approximate binomial value of the SSARs) the elected SSAR award value divided by the grant price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SSARs provide upside potential for share accumulation and greater alignment with shareholders because SSARS only have value if the stock price increases after the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The adjustment factor for SSARs is 1.0.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SSARs become exercisable on a stated vesting date, which is approximately three years from the grant date, and expire on the seventh anniversary of the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SSARs do not require a financial investment by the SSAR grantee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 100%   RSUs     RSUs are our promise to issue unrestricted shares of our stock on the stated vesting date, which is approximately three years from the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The adjustment factor for RSUs is 1.0.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RSUs do not require a financial investment by the RSU grantee.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of our compensation program, we offer U.S.-based executives and other senior employees an opportunity to participate in our DCP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the terms of the DCP, we provide the same level of matching contributions to our executive officers that are available to other employees under our 401(k) savings plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also use the DCP to encourage executives to acquire shares of our common stock that are economically equivalent to ownership of our common stock but on a tax-deferred basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do this to encourage executives to be long-term owners of a significant equity stake in our Company and to enhance the alignment between the interests of executives and those of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our costs in offering the DCP consist of the time-value of money costs, the cost of the matching contribution that supplements the 401(k) savings plan, administrative costs and a 25% premium for amounts deferred into the IFF Share Fund in an executives DCP account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The premium on amounts deferred into the IFF Share Fund typically do not vest until approximately two years after the deferral is made, as the premium is contingent on the executive remaining employed by us (other than for retirement) for the full calendar year following the year when such deferral is made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If notional investments within the DCP increase in value, the amount of our payment obligation will increase.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The time-value of money cost results from the delay in the time at which we can take tax deductions for compensation payable to a participating executive.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ESP provides severance and other benefits to executives, including NEOs, whose employment is terminated by the Company without cause or in the event of a termination by the executive for good reason in connection with a change in control of the Company Additionally, the ESP provides severance and other benefits in the case of NEOs whose employment is terminated by the Company for good reason not in connection with a change in control.

sentences.text: This policy helps us in competing with other companies in recruiting and retaining qualified executives.

sentences.text: Roles and Responsibilities
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee       The Committee is responsible for overseeing the determination, implementation and administration of executive compensation (including equity awards, benefits and perquisites).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee recommends CEO compensation to the independent directors of the Board for their approval and approves the compensation of all the other NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Consultant       Frederic W. Cook & Co., Inc. (FW Cook) is engaged as the Committees independent compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since August 2015, FW Cook has worked with the Committee to provide it with analyses, advice, guidance and recommendations on executive compensation levels versus peers, market trends and incentive plan designs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FW Cook is engaged exclusively by the Committee on executive and non-employee director compensation matters and does not have other consulting arrangements with us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considers the independence of FW Cook on an annual basis, and in 2016 it determined FW Cook was independent and that no conflicts of interest existed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management       Our CEO and CHRO evaluate the individual performance and, with input from the Committees independent compensation consultant, the competitive pay positioning for senior management members that report directly to the CEO, including our NEOs, and make recommendations to the Committee concerning each such executives target compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO follows the same process with regard to the target compensation for our CHRO, without her input, and the Committee follows the same process with regard to the target compensation for our CEO, without his input.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Advisory Vote
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of its compensation setting process, the Committee also considers the results of the prior years shareholder advisory vote on our executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes these voting results provide useful insight as to whether shareholders agree that the Committee is achieving its goal of designing and administering an executive compensation program that promotes the best interests of our Company and our shareholders by providing its executives with appropriate compensation and meaningful incentives to deliver strong financial performance and increase shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of its 2016 compensation setting process, the Committee reviewed the results of the 2015 shareholder advisory vote, in which 94.6% of the votes cast were voted in favor of our executive compensation program.

sentences.text: Peer Group and Benchmarking
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On an annual basis, the Committee reviews and approves the compensation of our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use a global grading structure for our NEOs, with compensation ranges for each grade.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs are placed in a particular grade based on internal factors (including scope of responsibilities and job complexity) and an external market evaluation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The external market evaluation is based on published third party general survey information and a review of similar positions within our selected peer groups described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This process is referred to as market benchmarking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Market Benchmarking
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviews its external market benchmarking and peer group data annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees goals are to position (1) target total cash compensation at median or slightly above and (2) target total direct compensation (salary, annual incentive compensation and long-term incentive compensation) between the median to 75th percentile of relevant market benchmarks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This philosophy reflects the Committees approach to setting stretch goals that require above median performance to generate target payouts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In August 2015, the Committee reviewed peer group data with our independent compensation consultant for purposes of determining the appropriate peer group for setting 2016 compensation levels and opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees independent compensation consultant provides the 25th percentile, median and 75th percentile market reference data for each executive position based on the average of the two relevant compensation benchmarks, as further explained below under Peer GroupsCEO, CFO and Group Presidents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This data is used to analyze the external competitiveness of each NEOs base salary, target total cash compensation and target total direct compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This analysis is reviewed with the Committee and, in the case of the compensation of NEOs other than the CEO, with the CEO as well.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining target total direct compensation for each executive in 2016, the Committee considered the consultants market reference analysis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Committee considered a number of other important factors, including each executives:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: individual experience and performance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: scope of responsibilities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: relative responsibilities compared with other senior Company executives;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: contribution relative to overall Company performance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: compensation relative to his or her peers within the organization; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: long-term potential.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee uses the market reference range in order to establish a starting point for the compensation levels that the Committee believes would provide our NEOs with competitive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the actual target total direct compensation approved by the Committee may be above or below the market reference range based on the Committees review of market compensation levels, its desire to create internal pay equity among our executives and the individual factors set forth above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the Committee awarded target total direct compensation to Messrs. Fibig, Haeni, Mirzayantz and Mmes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chwat and Cornell, and to Mr. OLeary following his promotion, that was generally within the competitive range of the targeted median to 75th percentile.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The total actual compensation paid for the year, as compared to target compensation approved at the beginning of the year, may differ depending on Company and individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consequently, the actual compensation received by a NEO may be higher or lower than his or her market reference range.

sentences.text: The Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act of 2010 (known as the Dodd-Frank Act) requires us to provide our shareholders with the opportunity to approve, on a nonbinding, advisory basis, the compensation of our NEOs as disclosed in this proxy statement in accordance with the compensation disclosure rules of the SEC, often referred to as Say on Pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The core of our executive compensation philosophy is that our executives compensation should be linked to achievement of financial and operating performance metrics that build shareholder value over both the short- and long-term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have designed our compensation program to focus on elements that we believe will contribute to these shareholder value drivers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As such, our compensation program:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: includes a significant equity component,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: is variable and tied to value-creating performance metrics,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reflects each executives level of responsibility, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: rewards individual performance and contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, approximately 93% of the votes cast on our say-on-pay proposal relating to 2015 executive compensation voted for the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pension Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide a defined benefit pension plan (the U.S. Pension Plan) to eligible United States-based employees hired before January 1, 2006.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Of our NEOs, only Mr. Mirzayantz currently participates in the U.S. Pension Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: U.S. employees hired on or after January 1, 2006, including all of our other NEOs, are not eligible to participate in the U.S. Pension Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We pay the full cost of providing benefits under the U.S. Pension Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation and service earned after December 31, 2007 are not taken into account in determining an employees benefit under the U.S. Pension Plan except for employees whose combined age and years of service equaled or exceeded 70 as of December 31, 2007.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As Mr. Mirzayantz did not satisfy this requirement, Mr. Mirzayantz had his benefit frozen as of December 31, 2007.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The monthly pension benefit is equal to the number of years of credited service as of December 31, 2016 times the difference between
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) 1.7% times final average compensation, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) 1.25% times the social security amount.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Final average compensation for purposes of the U.S. Pension Plan is the average of the five consecutive years of compensation during the last ten years before December 31, 2007 that produce the highest average.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The term compensation means the basic rate of monthly salary (as of April 1 each year) plus 1/12 of any AIP cash award received for the preceding year, reduced by any compensation deferred under our DCP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The normal retirement age under the U.S. Pension Plan is age 65.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Various provisions of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (IRC) limit the amount of compensation used in determining benefits payable under our U.S. Pension Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We established a non-qualified Supplemental Retirement Plan to pay that part of the pension benefit that, because of these IRC limitations, cannot be paid under the U.S. Pension Plan to our U.S. senior executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of the Supplemental Retirement Plan, compensation includes any salary and AIP amounts, including amounts deferred under our DCP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees with at least 10 years of service are eligible for early retirement under the U.S. Pension Plan and the Supplemental Retirement Plan beginning at age 55.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefit at early retirement is an unreduced benefit payable at age 62 or a reduced benefit (4% per year) if paid prior to age 62.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-Qualified Deferred Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We offer our executive officers and other senior employees based in the United States an opportunity to defer compensation under our non-qualified deferred compensation plan, or DCP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The DCP allows these employees to defer salary, annual and long-term incentive awards and receipt of stock under some equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There is no limit on the amount of compensation that a participant may elect to defer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to certain limitations on the number of installments and periods over which installments will be paid, participants in the DCP elect the timing and number of installments as to which the participants DCP account will be settled.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred cash compensation may be treated at the election of the participant as invested in:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a variety of equity and debt mutual funds offered by The Vanguard Group, which administers the DCP, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a fund valued by reference to the value of our common stock with dividends reinvested (the IFF Stock Fund), o
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: an interest-bearing account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except for deferrals into the IFF Stock Fund, the participant may generally change his or her choice of funds at any time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the interest-bearing account, our Compensation Committee establishes an interest rate each year which we intend to be equal to 120% of the applicable federal long-term interest rate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016 this interest rate was 3.10% and for 2017 this interest rate is 2.69%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We make matching contributions under the DCP to make up for tax limitations on our matching contributions under our Retirement Investment Fund Plan, a 401(k) plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 401(k) plan provides for matching contributions at a rate of $1.00 for each dollar of contribution up to 4% of a participants salary plus $0.75 for each dollar of contribution above 4% up to 8% of a participants salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax rules limit the amount of the Company match under the 401(k) plan for our senior executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The DCP matching contribution
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reflects the amount of the matching contribution which is limited by the tax laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The same requirements under the 401(k) plan for matching, including vesting, apply to matching contributions under the DCP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These matching contributions automatically vest once a participant completes three years of service with our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All our NEOs are in Tier I. Mr. Fibigs offer letter has modified some of the relevant definitions, amounts and other terms regarding the benefits that he is eligible to receive under the ESP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In October 2016, we entered into a separation agreement with Ms. Cornell pursuant to which she received severance benefits under the ESP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Other Separation Arrangements below for a discussion of Mr. Fibigs benefits and a description of Ms. Cornells separation agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our ESP provides for acceleration of equity, severance payments and continuation of benefits in connection with an executives termination (1) if his or her employment is terminated by us without Cause or (2) in the case that such termination occurs within two years of a Change in Control, if his or her employment is terminated without Cause or he or she terminates his or her employment for Good Reason.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, a Tier I executive is eligible to receive payments if he or she terminates his or her employment for Good Reason prior to or more than two years after a Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ESP states that a Change in Control (or CiC) will be deemed to have occurred when any of the following has occurred:   a person or group becomes the beneficial owner of 40% or more of the combined voting power of our then outstanding voting securities, other than beneficial ownership by us, any of our employee benefit plans or any person organized, appointed or established pursuant to the terms of any such benefit plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: individuals who, at February 7, 2017, constituted a majority of the Board (the Incumbent Directors) cease to constitute a majority of the Board for any reason; provided, however, that
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) any individual becoming a director subsequent to February 7, 2017 whose election or nomination for election to the Board was approved by a vote of at least two-thirds of the Incumbent Directors then on the Board shall be an Incumbent Director and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) any individual initially elected or nominated as a director as a result of an actual or threatened election contest shall not be an Incumbent Director; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the consummation of (A) a merger, consolidation, reorganization or similar transaction with us or in which our securities are issued, as a result of which the holders of our outstanding voting securities immediately before such event own, directly or indirectly, immediately after such event less than 60% of the combined voting power of the outstanding voting securities of the parent entity resulting from, or issuing its voting securities as part of, such event; (B) our complete liquidation or dissolution; or (C) a sale or other disposition of all or substantially all of our assets to any person.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: failure of the executive to perform his or her material duties in any material respect, which if reasonably susceptible to cure, has continued after written notice of such failure has been provided and the executive has not cured such failure within 10 days of receipt of such written notice;

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the executive being indicted or convicted of (or having pled guilty or nolo contendere to) a felony or any crime involving moral turpitude, dishonesty, fraud, theft or financial impropriety; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a material and willful violation by the executive of our rules, policies or procedures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Good Reason means any of the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a material decrease in the executives base salary, target bonus under an AIP, LTIP or Equity Choice Award, other than as part of an across-the-board reduction applicable to all similarly situated employees;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a material diminution in the executives authority, duties or responsibilities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: relocation of executives primary work location more than 50 miles from executives primary work location at the time of such requested relocation; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: our failure to obtain the binding agreement of any successor expressly to assume and agree to fully perform our obligations under the ESP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, good reason will only exist if the executive gives us notice within 90 days after the initial occurrence of any of the foregoing events and we fail to correct the matter within 30 days following receipt of such notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Gross-Up.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives are not entitled to receive a tax gross-up payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead, their severance payments would be subject to a modified cut-back provision, where severance or other payments to that executive would be reduced if this reduction would produce a better after-tax result for the executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There would be no reduction, however, if the executive (who would be responsible for any excise tax) would have a better after-tax result without the reduction.

sentences.text: In August 2015, the French government adopted a new law providing for the grant of RSUs with preferential tax treatment if certain requirements were satisfied (French-Qualified RSUs).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In December 2016, the French government adopted further changes to this law under which French-Qualified RSUs may be granted (as modified in December 2016, the Macron Law).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to this law, employees receiving French-Qualified RSUs will not be subject to taxation at the time of vesting, but instead will be subject to taxation at the time the shares acquired pursuant to the French-Qualified RSUs are subsequently sold.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, under the Macron Law, employer social contributions that were originally due at the time of grant of French-Qualified RSUs have been deferred to the date of vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among the conditions for granting French-Qualified RSUs under the Macron Law is that the French-Qualified RSUs are granted pursuant to an equity incentive plan approved by shareholders after December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our 2015 SAIP provides that the Compensation Committee has the full discretionary authority to adopt rules and regulations for administration of the 2015 SAIP as may be deemed necessary or appropriate to satisfy the laws of other countries, and to allow for tax-preferred treatment of awards.

sentences.text: In order to allow us to grant awards to employees in France in a tax preferential manner under the Macron Law, our Board has adopted the Rules of the International Flavors & Fragrances Inc. 2015 Stock Award and Incentive Plan for Grants of Restricted Stock Unit Awards in France, which operates under the 2015 SAIP (the French Sub-Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are now asking our shareholders to approve the French Sub-Plan for the purpose of qualifying under the Macron Law in France, so that RSUs that are granted under the French Sub-Plan to individuals who are subject to taxation under French law may qualify for the specific tax treatment described under the Macron Law.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: French-Qualified RSUs may not vest and settle prior to the expiration of the minimum mandatory vesting period under French law.

sentences.text: However, in the event of the death of a French holder of French-Qualified RSUs, such RSU holders heirs may request that the shares subject to the RSUs be transferred to them during the six-month period following the RSU holders death and if such a request is made, the RSUs must vest in full and the shares be issued to the heirs.
